summary: The "Oyster Reef Recovery Act of 2025" directs the Secretary of Commerce, via NOAA, to establish the Oyster Reef Restoration and Conservation Program. This program will provide technical and financial aid, including competitive grants, to various government, non-profit, academic, and private entities. The funds are for identifying, restoring, monitoring, and conserving oyster reefs. The bill supports research, construction, workforce training, and developing best practices for coastal resilience. It authorizes the appropriation of $15 million annually for fiscal years 2026 through 2030 to carry out these activities.
